name: biomni-analyze-ciliary-beat-frequency
title: Biomni: Analyze Ciliary Beat Frequency
description: Analyze ciliary beat frequency from high-speed video microscopy data using FFT analysis.
content:
Overview

Analyze ciliary beat frequency from high-speed video microscopy data using FFT (Fast Fourier Transform) analysis. This tool processes high-speed video recordings of motile cilia to quantify their beating frequency, which is critical for assessing ciliary function in respiratory epithelium and other ciliated tissues.

Input Parameters

  • video_path (required): Path to high-speed video file of ciliated cells
  • roi_count (optional, default=5): Number of regions of interest to analyze
  • min_freq (optional, default=0): Minimum frequency to detect (Hz)
  • max_freq (optional, default=30): Maximum frequency to detect (Hz)
  • output_dir (optional, default='./'): Directory for output files

Biological Use Case

This analysis is valuable for:

  • Diagnosing primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD) and related ciliopathies
  • Assessing mucociliary clearance function in respiratory disease
  • Studying the effects of drugs or environmental factors on ciliary motility
  • Evaluating ciliary function in reproductive biology and development
  • Quality control for in vitro airway epithelial cultures

Output

Returns ciliary beat frequency analysis including:

  • Mean beat frequency for each ROI (Hz)
  • Overall average beat frequency across all ROIs
  • Standard deviation and quality metrics
  • Frequency spectrum plots for each ROI

Category

physiology
